Title: Coffee walnut loaf
Author: Felicity
Intro: This little loaf comes together quickly and is great for afternoon tea.
Body:
This is a classic flavour combination that I am a big fan of.
It is such a good loaf for afternoon tea with its lovely soft cake crumb, crunchy walnuts and delicious caffeine infused icing.
Give it a go. Even the non-coffee lovers may be swayed.
Method: Preheat oven to 140˚C fan bake. Line a loaf tin with baking paper and set aside
Stir butter, sugar, milk and coffee in a medium saucepan over low heat until smooth
Whisk flour and cinnamon together in a bowl
Add the butter mix, eggs and half of the walnuts to the dry ingredients. Mix to combine
Pour into tin and bake for 15 minutes
Sprinkle the remaining walnuts over the loaf and bake for a further 30 mins. Set aside to cool while you make the icing
To make the icing combine the water, coffee and butter in a bowl
Add the icing sugar then heat over a small saucepan of water until smooth
Drizzle icing over the cake and enjoy
